intro: Wikstroemia caumii, commonly known as the Hawaiian sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has opposite, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
